meanings.definition: To dry or become dry again.
meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, the sun quickly redries the wet clothes.
meanings.sent2: She always redries her hair with a towel after washing it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to redries a wet sponge instantly!
meanings.sent4: His laughter redries her tears, bringing a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The desert sun relentlessly redries the cracked earth.

meanings.definition: The act of drying or becoming dry again.
meanings.sent1: The redries of the laundry were hanging on the clothesline.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the redries of the spilled water on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The redries of the paint on the wall made it look like a modern art piece.
meanings.sent4: The redries of the riverbed revealed hidden treasures beneath.
meanings.sent5: The redries of the leaves in autumn signaled the arrival of winter.
